text:
e="preserve">James Elbert "Tootie" Robbins (June 2, 1958 – August 2, 2020) was an American professional football player. He was an offensive tackle for 12 seasons in the National Football League (NFL) for the Phoenix Cardinals and the Green Bay Packers. Robbins was born in Windsor, North Carolina.
Robbins died on August 2, 2020 from COVID-19 at the age of 62.
